Topic.Title: Here's what's going to happen.

Message.Msg: If Romney is elected the market rallies for maybe a week at most and then dies. Look at history. Although Wall Street always wants the low tax candidate of the rich, the market knows better and collapses when Wall Street gets its wishes. Cutting taxes for the middle class means they have more money to spend, which can fatten corporate profits; cutting taxes for the top 2 percent simply throws resources away . They already buy whatever they want. You have to be a foolish toady of the greedy rich class to think otherwise. If Romney wins, you need to get out of the market before year end. (I don't think he can win; the teapulbicans have antagonized the Hispanic population with their attitude toward immigrants. That is likely to be enough to tip the tide in Colorado and a few other states to re-elect Obama. Don't get me wrong. I am no fan of Obama, but Romney is worss for the market and the country.)

Topic.Title: HERE IS PROOF SYBIL IS A LIAR!!!

Message.Msg: Sybs broker providez the option to perform direct trades and chose one of many exchanges or trading houses to trade. From 4:01 to 8:00 pm, sybil can trade all the live long after hours day douchbag, without being locked into any particular trading house for order execution.. If you have enough money in your account to get level 2 then watch it jump around on a report day for a stok between 4 and 4:15, showing you all the tradez that you are missing .... When you tealize that sybil iz correct and really think about it as you watch prices hopping around like crazy, think "thats old sybil scalping my money" arshole.

Topic.Title: AMZN price action not hard to understand

Message.Msg: I added to my position at close. I will add much more Monday if it remains elevated. The overconfident longs are gonna get taken to the woodshed. I suspect the big shorts squeezed weak shorts out and used cheap calls to cover many more shorts, all while buying very inexpensive puts. I added 50% late Friday (although around $236, so I'm down on those). I will adjust the strikes on all my options Monday for black Tues/Wed. Pretty soon, we will see carnage from the behind the scenes battles amongst funds to juice performance, even when knowingly investing in scams like this. Those who bought Friday will literally have an IMPOSSIBLE task in explaining to LPs why they did when amazon does crater. It's cavalier. It's negligent. Not one would do it with his/her own money. Responsible LP's should be closely examining this event. It will tell them a lot about the true character of the people managing their funds... even if it worked for a day, it will lead to massive losses in time.

Topic.Title: Here's what's going to happen.

Message.Msg: Romney may end up being worse for the market, but not for the reason you give, You need to turn off MSNBC and stop spouting the lefts mantra of "lower taxes on the rich at the expense of the middle class". It is a lie, just like everything else that comes out of their mouth. Romney may be a negative for the market because 1) he will fire money printer in chief Bernanke and 2) he is going to have to take measures to reduce our deficit which may not be the best for the economy. I believe his economic policies will help negate the effect of reduced spending in other areas so #2 isn't as big of a concern to me.

Topic.Title: Here's what's going to happen.

Message.Msg: I happen to believe the opposite. I think as it becomes clearer and clearer over the next couple weeks that Romney will win, the market rallies into and then a few days after the election will be the high for the year. The market will back down and try to rally back. Earnings season will be essentially over by election day and there won't be any earnings news. Obama will not lift a finger to avoid the fiscal cliff and the Dems in Congress will not do anything either to help. So there will be uncertainty until inaugeration day. Congress will do what it always does, and just extend everything another few months or so. The market doesn't like that so we will start to sell off. There might be a rally soon after Romney is sworn in, but it too, will fade as we get back into Washington gridlock. 2013 will be a dismal year in the stock market. AMZN will peak here pretty soon. I see it going back up even more. I see a double top looming.

Right now its in the blow off phase before it collapses to bk on any one of its poorly executed business plans.... Happy shorting cash....

Second, Geeg short interest is 33% below its peak of last year. This pig won't fly much longer. only real question is who will have cement shoes being tossed overboard for EOY performance reporting whether that be FY or CY... There will be some massive last second volatility because the risk of perpetuating this scam will grow exponentially as more events transpire (just as I was correct from last Oct Geeg, we are just getting started with Apple and Google going after Amazon's cash generating digital prayer). The Playground opens soon...

Topic.Title: AMZN price action not hard to understand

Message.Msg: Poetic justice. Irony at work. I have a typo when mocking GeeGee (it is too easy and I wasn't concentrating). GeeGee, I have many faults in this lifetime, but being stupid simply isn't one of them. I'm light years ahead of you and most invested in this stock in terms of understanding how the competitive landscape will evolve. There is a non negligable chance that Amazon will start to have cash flow problems and will need to either issue debt or new equity. Apple and Google will go after Amazon's core. People freaked on Pandora with Apple moving into radio (should have affected Amazon as well). Similar moves are coming in the rest of digital media that will affect Amazon more directly. And Google is about to announce more of the same. Bring it chump.

Message.Msg: LION BROADCASTING: MASSIVE CIVIL UNREST IN USA 2013, prepare for survival USA is a failed state(ROME did not burn in a Day Americans are History without Revolution: Dr. Paul Craig Roberts ----------------------- Thomas Jefferson and Eisenhower warned us long time ago: I believe that banking institutions are more dangerous to our liberties than standing armies. If the American people ever allow private banks to control the issue of their currency, first by inflation, then by deflation, the banks and corporations that will grow up around [the banks] will deprive the people of all property until their children wake-up homeless on the continent their fathers conquered. The issuing power should be taken from the banks and restored to the people, to whom it properly belongs. Thomas Jefferson, (Attributed) 3rd president of US (1743 - 1826) Andrew Jackson quotes: Gentlemen, I have had men watching you for a long time and I am convinced that you have used the funds of the bank to speculate in the breadstuffs of the country. When you won, you divided the profits amongst you, and when you lost, you charged it to the bank. You tell me that if I take the deposits from the bank and annul its charter, I shall ruin ten thousand families. That may be true, gentlemen, but that is your sin! Should I let you go on, you will ruin fifty thousand families, and that would be my sin! You are a den of vipers and thieves. Catherine Austin Fitts: "They're Going to Depopulate or Bankrupt the Rest of Us" Catherine Austin Fitts calls what happened to the U.S since the market meltdown of 2008 a “fiscal coup d’état.” Fitts should know because she is a former Wall Street insider who has managed investments worth $300 billion. She is also a government insider. Catherine Austin Fitts was an Assistant Secretary for HUD in the first Bush Administration more than 20 years ago. She says our leaders are “. . . doing a number of things that are going to depopulate or bankrupt the rest of us.” Why are people so ill-informed? Fitts says it’s because, “Corporate media is lying to you and wasting your time.” She also says, “Were going through a period of great change, and the pace is going to accelerate.” And, “Gold will be at the center of a new currency that will emerge.” Join Greg Hunter as he goes One-on-One with Catherine Austin Fitts of The Solari Report. ---------------------------------------- RED ALERT IN USA MARY SCAHPIRO/ROBERT KHUZAMI/ROBERT COOK IS A CRIMINAL SCAM GANG AT S.E.C SERVING FRAUD STREET FINANCIAL BANKSTER TERRORISTS AND CORPORATE THUGS TO LOOT EVERY PENNY IN USA WORKING CLASS PENSIONS...... NEW SLOGAN IN USA WALL STREET IS NOW PURE FRAUD STREET CASINO AND RIGGED WITH ALL SCAM LEGISLATION AGAINST 99% WORKING CLASS AND ALL FRAUD LOOT PROTECTION FOR CORPORATE THUGS AND BANKSTER FINANCIAL TERRORISTS AT S.E.C ENFORCED AND ALL LOOT MANIPULATION SCAM WEAPONS AT THEIR DISPOSAL LOOT/SCAM/BANG USA 99% WORKING CLASS PENSION CONTRIBUTIONS IN BILLIONS WITH DARK POOLS AND HIGH FREQUENCY TRADING MACHINES WITH FRAUD PRICE/VOLUME MANIPULATION WITHOUT ANY FEAR IF, BY MISTAKE YOU ARE CAUGHT? NO PROBLEM COME TO MARY SCHAPIRO/ROBERT KHUZAMI/ROBERT COOK SCAM WATCH PARASITES AT S.E.C AND P[AY LITTLE FINE, NO TRIALS AND KEEP YOUR LOOT IN BILLIONS AND YOU ARE FREE TO GO BACK AND START YOUR SCAM LOOT ASAP................. Gene Burnett - Jump You F*#kers (A Song For Wall Street) --------------- A Lonely Redemption He is no less suspicious of Goldman Sachs, which has alumni sprinkled across the upper reaches of government. In a tough spot, Goldman obtained extraordinary permission to make an overnight metamorphosis from investment bank to traditional bank holding company. “Can I prove this was a wired deal? Absolutely not,” Mr. Lewis said. “Am I certain of it? Only 100 percent.” As for the whirling, three-million-shares-per-second casino of Wall Street? He sees it as rigged. “I would not risk stocks under any circumstances,” he said, “because we don’t know when this thing is going to blow.” Nothing about Mr. Lewis is easy. He delights in sending scabrous, insulting, free-associative mass e-mails to journalists, financiers and members of Congress. Show annoyance, and he doubles down. “You know what I do with tension?” he said. “I ratchet it up!” ------------------------------------------------------------ The Mayan calendar points to the end of the world coming in December. It may not end on that date but major disruptions can be anticipated. CENTRAL banks have fully uncorked the printing presses to meet the waves of insolvency set to STRIKE the banksters, public servants and the elites. Transferring your wealth to themselves and their something for nothing societies to PAY for their moral and fiscal insolvencies. There is an incredible number potential crisis in the short term (3 to 6 months); any one could spark a major financial, economic and political crisis by themselves. Taken together they practically GUARANTEE it. Fat tails and black swans loom. They really are only black swans and fat tails to Keynesian economists, for those of the Austrian camp they are PREDICTABLE and INEVITABLE! Look at this litany of UNFOLDING CATASTROPHES from a recent Financial Times............ Collapsing economies, capital flight from weak to the strong (target 2 sends the funds right back to the failing central banks), planned tax increases and mandatory spending cuts, and chronic current account and BUDGET deficits. You must understand that the US fiscal cliff was the ONLY answer for politicians who need someone else to blame for what MUST come to pass. So they did the deal and now can point to each other with no one specific to blame. My opinion: the spending cuts need to be retained and all government spending must be frozen. The government does not need any more money for INVESTMENTS (spending). “Nothing in government happens by accident, if it happens you can be certain it was planned that way.” --Franklin Delano Roosevelt Now let’s look at the greatest BLACK swan of them all, one far from the headlines but the HEART of the currency and financial system EXTINCTION event

Topic.Title: AMZN IS A $30 STOCK

Message.Msg: Yes, but it will take time before the stupid people realize that!

Topic.Title: AMZN price action not hard to understand

Message.Msg: Geeg: Only to those who do not understand cognitive biases and behavioral investing. It's why people like you catch knives and ultimately (I guess) how natural selection works. In a rational world, Amazon would never have gone above $150 (and even then it would be extended). I normally try to protect people from that which they don't yet see, but will become apparent in time. As you posted from my prognostication last year, I see evolving competitive dynamics very clearly. Because I invest my own money, I don't play the #$%$ games of WS analysts who are trying to get people to buy overpriced crap. I post intellectually honest and clinical assessments of the fundamentals. Let's take a few: 1) Claim: Gross margins are going up. Fact: Only because of malinvestment in redundant (in the macro sense since warehouse and distribution is anything but scarce in this country) fulfillment centers, which has dramatically reduced the return on invested capital. 2) Claim: Amazon will have enormous leverage going forward. Fact: Operating Cash flow per dollar of revenue has decreased dramatically since 2009. FCF is MUCH worse. 3) Claim: Amazon will make ton on digital content. Fact: it already dominates books and really mainly has downside there. Conjecture: Further, as distribution channels proliferate and HW vendows seek to embed more value in their offering, they will compete economic rents out of digital content distribution/retailing. This source of cash flow will collapse. Dude, you are in over your head. Don't try to mess with me. I don't fall prey to the psychological #$%$ that you and other wannabe predators perpetuate. I have a compass called fundamentals and competitive strategic insight that makes it easy to ride through this crap. Please load up GeeGee. You deserve to get all that is coming...

Topic.Title: Same old story . . .

Message.Msg: How can you with this valuation? Let's face it Bezos carries a ton of credibility which I don't fully understand since I admittedly never followed this company closely. The valuation always looked nuts to me. If he said he was leaving and transitioning out over the next 6 months the stock would get cut in half in a heartbeat. I have shorted this for short term gains previously in the high $250's and over $260 and I'll look for the opportunity again but to be fair I will try to see it from both sides. One thing I do know is that when the market gets frothy and the MOMO stocks like AMZN keep going up without improved fundamentals, they typically go down harder and faster when the market corrects.

Message.Msg: No way this will happen. Last time AMZ retest 260 was when the indices are at multi year high. No way the indices can get back up there not without some encouraging economic data. If AMZN is going against the economic current than it will be crushed once it get there. AMZN already show a double top in the chart. Triple top is unlikely in this environment.

What a ride from $440 to $235 in just 6 months. You were right all along on the fall. Also, your long pick NSPH - wow, more than doubled since January. So what are you trading now? Topic.Title: AMZN price action not hard to understand

Message.Msg: Short percentage is not high enough to support this argument. It is an HFT short squeeze by institutional movers defending Nov call options from an abysmal earnings, an easy way to abuse shorty for a making a make sense play. it is destructive of market confidence and stronly highlits the disparity between earnings and price discovery. It means the market is DEAD for the retail investor. Shorty should not cover in this range, but add if he has the power, just like Techstrategy. 11M shares is pure churn. I strongly suspect some insider hedge fund backroom deal for a back and forth exchange on high frequency shares. This is tape paint and churn one hundred percent. Look at that PE! The stock is behaving as if there were a massive beat and the trend on earnings is more than abysmal. I remember the last tech bubble pop. That is what is happening here, a massive tech bubble. Yahoo is showing 2800x earnings and you want to chase that manipulated green. There is evil, and then there is this. What is to stop the manipulation and cause a resumption of sanity? Nothing but jail time for manipulator HFT trade firms. Can it continue to fly up? Yes. Strong yes. Is it a gamble that relies on further manipulation? STRONG YES. But let's put nothing past these crooks. What keeps it from trading at 1M times earnings? Nothing at all until something is done about this crooked market. If even Cramer says sell, the corporate pusher, you know something stinks.

Topic.Title: amzn today was possibly the most bizarre action ever for a stk

Message.Msg: We love all you shorts over here at the Amazon board. I myself, love how negative you are on Amazon. I know you don't get it, most of the shorts on here would need to see videos of the best warehouses for 30 minutes straight to get it. After the shorts were shown wal mart, fedex and ups warehouses, then lastly they were shown how much faster, wiser, and simpler the Amazon warehouses move product around. Then they would finally get it and understand why Jeffie spends so much on research and development of his warehouses. You see the longs are at the point where they park money on the side, waiting for the instance AMZN gets whacked a little to get a bigger and bigger long position. They have learned they get 1 day tops to add to AMZN whenever it gets whacked, so they add immediately. Now that the longs always add at the same time or day,it scares the chit out of the shorts who must cover thus helping to send AMZN higher then it was going to go anyway. 1st major squeeze to 300, 2nd major squeeze to 360, amzn will top at 360 and drift slowly down to 320 after that before another lift off starts. I have taken my time to explain and help you shorts. You can take my advice or donate more money to myself and the loyal amzn longs, your choice.

Topic.Title: Techstrategy

Message.Msg: Thanks. This is the best short in the world at this point. Hands down, bar none. I added Friday and will add a lot more. In terms of longs, the best long in the world right now is INTC, by far. There's a lot of analysis underlying those positions, but I think anyone with common sense gets it intuitively. The two bit hypester above talked about Amazon's amazing warehouse. Rocket science. Not. Yet, Amazon while losing money and seeing its cash balance and cash flow degrade rapidly is shooting through the roof. INTC is trading at less than 5X cash flow. Intel is pioneering 14nm tri gate (3D FINFET architecture) transitors and no one else is close. They are vastly more energy/power efficient, which is why INTC is dominating servers. Those capabilities will enable it to dominate mobile as well. The economics of chip production depends heavily on feature/die size. INTC is a generation ahead (14nm can fit roughly 2x the number OE chips per wafer) so it has a structural cost advantage. That is rocket science. Anyone not selling AMZN at these levels and buying INTC is not an investor. I never look at BT or any of that. Mainly a bunch of people trying to sense which way the wind is blowing instead of charting a course to the right destination. I think like a sailor. You can get to where you want even with the wind blowing against you the entire way.... It's called tacking and what I've done here....

Topic.Title: AMZN Trading Action

Message.Msg: Tech, I see 2 flaws with your proposition. #1- I've tried to educate friends and family about the abuses of WS and what's being done by the Fed and people look at you like your some conspiracy theorist. You lose most of the general public if the conversations doesn't start with "did you watch American Idol?" or "OMG! did you see Snookie?" #2- Does it really matter what the earnings/revenue/outlook is? I mean last quarter it was all about the revenue, that's why it went up. This quarter revenue didn't matter. It went up because of....why did it go up?? They showed a loss of 23c, what if it was 50c? or a dollar? does it sell off? I think this game plan was in place from the get go. But I think your right, the game is coming to a close. Added Jan DITM puts on Wed because the premiums was too expensive on every thing else. But I know this was possible so i left enough cash to add more. I doubled down right at the close on Fri and can double down again if need be. But should I go out to April? - PJ

Topic.Title: Who recalls TYCO, or Conseco or Bear Sterns. All blue chippers loved by Joo Street.

Message.Msg: For starters democracy is a form of government, opposite a dictatorship. Communism is an economic system where the government is in control of the economy, an extreme form of socialism if you will. In the US, there has been a shift to a more socialist agenda then there has been in decades but still a far cry from communism. There maybe forces at work behind the scenes (similar to what happened to AMZN on Friday) but the system is still intact and still strong and the people still make the final call. While I will not make any excuses for American war time propaganda against Germans, Japanese, Iraqi or Mexican nor will I ignore American travesties against Blacks and Native Americans. I will call #$%$ on your ignorance of the Holocaust. I have been to Auschwitz. The place still reeks of death. I've talked to the Polish people from the area, none deny what happened there and some have stories that will make the hair on your neck stand up. In your free time Google "Chelmno", the stories are all there, with pictures for you to believe. War is ugly, no doubt, and brings out the worst in people but what happen to the Jewish people was evil. - PJ....for the record I'm Roman Catholic p.s. Also, what happen in Dresden was a massacre. But if Germany stays in her borders none of that ever happens.

Topic.Title: Here's what's going to happen.

Message.Msg: That's ridiculous. Romney's economic advisor is Glenn Hubbard, the architect of the deficit. He sold W on the tax cuts against the advice of hundreds of the leading economists from all sides of the political spectrum. Hubbard and Romney are clueless about running the country. (All they know is how to rip people off for themselves. Hubbard appears to have had some conflict of interest problems; After the heat died down Columbia, where he now dean, seems to have tightened their conflicts rules.) Romney only fared okay in Massachusetts because he went along with the Democratic legislature. (They raised taxes and fees dozens of times.) With the Tea Party destroying the House, he won't get anywhere even if he had some idea what to do, which he doesn't. I am out of the market immediately if he wins. I would be out now if I thought he would win, but I think the Latinos will put Obama over the top because the Teapublicans seem to hate immigrants, both legal and illegal, and I suspect Gallup and Rasmussen are under counting them.
